result.execSummary:
The defendant Collin C. Campion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.
State moves to delete the repeater enhancers on counts 1 and 4.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge in count 1, felony bail jumping. Convicted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the charge in counts 3, possess narcotic drugs-2nd or subsequent offense.  Convicted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge in count 4, resist/obstruct officer.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2 and 5.  Motion granted.
On count 1, the defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for ninety (90) days, time served.
Defendant has credit for 90 days.
$355.00 court costs imposed and to be paid as a condition of probation on count 3.
DNA sample ordered.
On count 4, the defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for eight (8) days, time served.
Defendant has credit for 8 days.
$280.00 court costs imposed and to be paid as a condition of probation on count 3.
DNA sample ordered.
On count 3, sentence is withheld.  Defendant is placed on probation to DOC for two (2) years.
Conditions of probation:
1)	Pay court costs;
2)	pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC;
3)	provide DNA sample;
4)	maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination;
5)	Submit to random urine screens and pay for same;
6)	Maintain absolute sobriety;
7)	Assessment, treatment, counseling as determined appropriate by the Department's assessment process;
8)	AODA assessment and follow through;
9)	Any other counseling, treatment, assessments as recommended by the agent.
Minutes.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL -
Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody.
The bail is currently set at $500.00 cash.
Parties argue to motion.
The Court comments and denies the motion to modify bail.
State to draft order.
Plea date is set for 04-26-22 at 2:30 p.m. in Br. 2 along with other files.
Minutes.

Order Denying Motion to Modify Bail.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's Motion to modify bail is denied.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on April 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:10 PM Defendant Collin C. Campion appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Luke K Harrison appeared by video for Collin C. Campion, Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Inducement: Letter dated February 14, 2022
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for March 18, 2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Scheduling conference on April 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.addlTxt:
1:53 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Collin C. Campion appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing with the defendant.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Collin C. Campion
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 02-03-2022)
Prior: 7726 Eastshore Rd, Two Rivers, WI 54241
RE:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 01-27-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts felony bail jumping, misdemeanor bail jumping, possess Fentanyl and resist officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-07-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the condition that he not possess any controlled substances.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
